intro: Glenniea adami, commonly known as the sandstone glenniea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic shrubs. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to low moisture conditions. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Glenniea adami is known for its resilience and is often found in coastal and inland heathlands.
